alert.note: Alert for Adams; Arapahoe (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 4:34AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, Elbert. In northeast Colorado, Adams and Arapahoe. * WHEN...Until 700 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 434 AM MDT, Law enforcement reported flooding across portions of Elbert and Adams counties. Between 1 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... West Sand Creek, Gold Creek, Piney Creek, Bayou Gulch, Running Creek, Kiowa Creek, Little Dry Creek, Horse Creek, First Creek, Box Elder Creek, Dry Creek and Coal Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eastern Aurora, Bennett, Elizabeth, Manila Village, Watkins and Ponderosa Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
